trans-unit.source: How to use Queue storage from Ruby | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Queue storage from Ruby | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure Queue service to create and delete queues, and insert, get, and delete messages.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure Queue service to create and delete queues, and insert, get, and delete messages.

trans-unit.source: Samples written in Ruby.
trans-unit.target: Samples written in Ruby.

trans-unit.source: How to use Queue storage from Ruby
trans-unit.target: How to use Queue storage from Ruby

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios using the Microsoft
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios using the Microsoft

trans-unit.source: Azure Queue Storage service.
trans-unit.target: Azure Queue Storage service.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written using the Ruby Azure API.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written using the Ruby Azure API.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include **inserting**, **peeking**, **getting**,
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include **inserting**, **peeking**, **getting**,

trans-unit.source: and **deleting** queue messages, as well as **creating and deleting queues**.
trans-unit.target: and **deleting** queue messages, as well as **creating and deleting queues**.

trans-unit.source: Create a Ruby Application
trans-unit.target: Create a Ruby Application

trans-unit.source: Create a Ruby application.
trans-unit.target: Create a Ruby application.

trans-unit.source: For instructions,
trans-unit.target: For instructions,

trans-unit.source: see [Create a Ruby Application on Azure](/develop/ruby/tutorials/web-app-with-linux-vm/).
trans-unit.target: see [Create a Ruby Application on Azure](/develop/ruby/tutorials/web-app-with-linux-vm/).

trans-unit.source: Configure Your Application to Access Storage
trans-unit.target: Configure Your Application to Access Storage

trans-unit.source: To use Azure storage, you need to download and use the Ruby azure package, which includes a set of convenience libraries that communicate with the storage REST services.
trans-unit.target: To use Azure storage, you need to download and use the Ruby azure package, which includes a set of convenience libraries that communicate with the storage REST services.

trans-unit.source: Use RubyGems to obtain the package
trans-unit.target: Use RubyGems to obtain the package

trans-unit.source: Use a command-line interface such as **PowerShell** (Windows), **Terminal** (Mac), or **Bash** (Unix).
trans-unit.target: Use a command-line interface such as **PowerShell** (Windows), **Terminal** (Mac), or **Bash** (Unix).

trans-unit.source: Type "gem install azure" in the command window to install the gem and dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Type "gem install azure" in the command window to install the gem and dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Import the package
trans-unit.target: Import the package

trans-unit.source: Use your favorite text editor, add the following to the top of the Ruby file where you intend to use storage:
trans-unit.target: Use your favorite text editor, add the following to the top of the Ruby file where you intend to use storage:

trans-unit.source: Setup an Azure Storage Connection
trans-unit.target: Setup an Azure Storage Connection

trans-unit.source: The azure module will read the environment variables **AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCOUNT** and **AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCESS_KEY**
trans-unit.target: The azure module will read the environment variables **AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCOUNT** and **AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCESS_KEY**

trans-unit.source: for information required to connect to your Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: for information required to connect to your Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: If these environment variables are not set,
trans-unit.target: If these environment variables are not set,

trans-unit.source: you must specify the account information before using **Azure::QueueService** with the following code:
trans-unit.target: you must specify the account information before using **Azure::QueueService** with the following code:

trans-unit.source: To obtain these values:
trans-unit.target: To obtain these values:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the storage account you want to use
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the storage account you want to use

trans-unit.source: Click **MANAGE KEYS** at the bottom of the navigation pane.
trans-unit.target: Click **MANAGE KEYS** at the bottom of the navigation pane.

trans-unit.source: In the pop up dialog, you will see the storage account name, primary access key and secondary access key.
trans-unit.target: In the pop up dialog, you will see the storage account name, primary access key and secondary access key.

trans-unit.source: For access key, you can select either the primary one or the secondary one.
trans-unit.target: For access key, you can select either the primary one or the secondary one.

trans-unit.source: How To: Create a Queue
trans-unit.target: How To: Create a Queue

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a **Azure::QueueService** object, which enables you to work with queues.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a **Azure::QueueService** object, which enables you to work with queues.

trans-unit.source: Use the **create_queue()** method to create a queue with the specified name.
trans-unit.target: Use the **create_queue()** method to create a queue with the specified name.

trans-unit.source: How To: Insert a Message into a Queue
trans-unit.target: How To: Insert a Message into a Queue

trans-unit.source: To insert a message into a queue, use the **create_message()** method to create a new message and add it to the queue.
trans-unit.target: To insert a message into a queue, use the **create_message()** method to create a new message and add it to the queue.

trans-unit.source: How To: Peek at the Next Message
trans-unit.target: How To: Peek at the Next Message

trans-unit.source: You can peek at the message in the front of a queue without removing it from the queue by calling the **peek\_messages()** method.
trans-unit.target: You can peek at the message in the front of a queue without removing it from the queue by calling the **peek\_messages()** method.

trans-unit.source: By default, **peek\_messages()** peeks at a single message.
trans-unit.target: By default, **peek\_messages()** peeks at a single message.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify how many messages you want to peek.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify how many messages you want to peek.

trans-unit.source: How To: Dequeue the Next Message
trans-unit.target: How To: Dequeue the Next Message

trans-unit.source: You can remove a message from a queue in two steps.
trans-unit.target: You can remove a message from a queue in two steps.

trans-unit.source: When you call **list\_messages()**, you get the next message in a queue by default.
trans-unit.target: When you call **list\_messages()**, you get the next message in a queue by default.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify how many messages you want to get.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify how many messages you want to get.

trans-unit.source: The messages returned from **list\_messages()** becomes invisible to any other code reading messages from this queue.
trans-unit.target: The messages returned from **list\_messages()** becomes invisible to any other code reading messages from this queue.

trans-unit.source: You pass in the visibility timeout in seconds as a parameter.
trans-unit.target: You pass in the visibility timeout in seconds as a parameter.

trans-unit.source: To finish removing the message from the queue, you must also call **delete_message()**.
trans-unit.target: To finish removing the message from the queue, you must also call **delete_message()**.

trans-unit.source: This two-step process of removing a message assures that when your code fails to process a message due to hardware or software failure, another instance of your code can get the same message and try again.
trans-unit.target: This two-step process of removing a message assures that when your code fails to process a message due to hardware or software failure, another instance of your code can get the same message and try again.

trans-unit.source: Your code calls **delete\_message()** right after the message has been processed.
trans-unit.target: Your code calls **delete\_message()** right after the message has been processed.

trans-unit.source: How To: Change the Contents of a Queued Message
trans-unit.target: How To: Change the Contents of a Queued Message

trans-unit.source: You can change the contents of a message in-place in the queue.
trans-unit.target: You can change the contents of a message in-place in the queue.

trans-unit.source: The code below uses the **update_message()** method to update a message.
trans-unit.target: The code below uses the **update_message()** method to update a message.

trans-unit.source: The method will return a tuple which contains the pop receipt of the queue message and a UTC date time value that represents when the message will be visible on the queue.
trans-unit.target: The method will return a tuple which contains the pop receipt of the queue message and a UTC date time value that represents when the message will be visible on the queue.

trans-unit.source: How To: Additional Options for Dequeuing Messages
trans-unit.target: How To: Additional Options for Dequeuing Messages

trans-unit.source: There are two ways you can customize message retrieval from a queue.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways you can customize message retrieval from a queue.

trans-unit.source: You can get a batch of message.
trans-unit.target: You can get a batch of message.

trans-unit.source: You can set a longer or shorter invisibility timeout, allowing your code more or less time to fully process each message.
trans-unit.target: You can set a longer or shorter invisibility timeout, allowing your code more or less time to fully process each message.

trans-unit.source: The following code example uses the **list\_messages()** method to get 15 messages in one call.
trans-unit.target: The following code example uses the **list\_messages()** method to get 15 messages in one call.

trans-unit.source: Then it prints and deletes each message.
trans-unit.target: Then it prints and deletes each message.

trans-unit.source: It also sets the invisibility timeout to five minutes for each message.
trans-unit.target: It also sets the invisibility timeout to five minutes for each message.

trans-unit.source: How To: Get the Queue Length
trans-unit.target: How To: Get the Queue Length

trans-unit.source: You can get an estimation of the number of messages in the queue.
trans-unit.target: You can get an estimation of the number of messages in the queue.

trans-unit.source: The **get\_queue\_metadata()** method asks the queue service to return the approximate message count and metadata about the queue.
trans-unit.target: The **get\_queue\_metadata()** method asks the queue service to return the approximate message count and metadata about the queue.

trans-unit.source: How To: Delete a Queue
trans-unit.target: How To: Delete a Queue

trans-unit.source: To delete a queue and all the messages contained in it, call the **delete\_queue()** method on the queue object.
trans-unit.target: To delete a queue and all the messages contained in it, call the **delete\_queue()** method on the queue object.

trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.target: Now that you've learned the basics of queue storage, follow these links to learn about more complex storage tasks.

trans-unit.target: For a comparision between the Azure Queue Service discussed in this article and Azure Service Bus Queues discussed in the [How to use Service Bus Queues](/develop/ruby/how-to-guides/service-bus-queues/) article, see [Azure Queues and Azure Service Bus Queues - Compared and Contrasted](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh767287.aspx)
